name: Citrus Carne Asada Marinade
author: judy2304
summary: I have used this recipe for a number of years, and most often marinate enough steak for a few meals. After the marinade time, the steak can be frozen in meal-sized portions for quick meals later. The flavor of this carne asada is much better, and the meat much more tender, than any I have had in Mexican restaurants. If cut in strips, this meat also works very well for fajitas. Serve with tortillas, Mexican rice, and beans.
ingredients: 1 small bunch cilantro, chopped, or to taste
1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed
directions: Combine onion, soy sauce, lime juice, lemon juice, orange juice, cilantro, chili powder, garlic, cumin, oregano, coriander, hot sauce, chipotle pepper, black pepper, and sugar in a 1-gallon plastic zip-top bag
Marinate in the refrigerator, turning and massaging meat frequently, for up to 24 hours
Heat olive oil in a large frying pan over high heat
Cook steak until medium-rare to medium, 4 to 5 minutes per side
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 to 140 degrees F (54 to 60 degrees C)
